page.title: 02GEOGRAPHY AND ENVIRONMENT.
page.content: { {RELIEF}MOST OF THE AREA LIES BETWEEN 30+50 METRES ABOVE SEA LEVEL.THE NORTH WEST RISES TO 85M. {HOUSING}THE NORTH IS MOSTLY 19TH.C TERRACED BUILT ALONGSIDE THE GREAT WESTERN RAILWAY ON THE FLOOD PLAIN OF THE RIVER THAMES.THE REST IS MIDDLE 20TH.C SUBURBAN HOUSING ESTATES {INDUSTRY}MAINLY TERTIARY WITH MANY OFFICES AND C.B.D. ACTIVITY. SECONDARY IS RESTRICTED TO LIGHT ENGINEERING LOCATED ALONG THE MAIN WESTERN AND SOUTHERN TRANSPORT ROUTES. {FARMING}SOME DAIRYING IN THE FAR SOUTH. {TRANSPORT}THE SOUTH IS DOMINATED BY ROAD LINKS TO THE M4(JUST SOUTH OF REGION).THE MAIN LONDON TO WEST RAILWAY FORMS THE NORTHERN BOUNDARY OF THE BLOCK,WHICH ALSO INCLUDES READING'S MAIN STATION.
